title: Great food
text: WAs very surprised by my recent visit to Beefeater Horsham. Staff were lovely and the food was great. Reasonable sized portions for the price paid. Nice touch with the Christmas card.

title: Dreadful takeaway
text: The Indian Plaza used to be a great restaurant and take away. Sadly, over the last few months it has gone down hill. This perhaps has something to do with the new owners. First, they ow only accept cash only, considering they used to accept credit card, this would suggest some form of avoidance. Second, when collecting the curry, the heating was off - the place was freezing and none of the staff were wearing PPE. And finally, the family meal we ordered was bland, incorrect items were given, the curry all had a significant amount of oil and the popadoms were stale.

title: Not covid secure
text: While we were happy with the food, the drinks and especially the price we were disappointed that the staff did not enforce covid policy. Kitchen staff did not wear a face covering, customers were not asked to wear them when entering and customers also went to the counter to order (while sitting in).

title: Overwhelming food and poor tipping policy
text:
First, I thought the service we received was excellent. The waiter was outstanding and went the extra mile at all times. However, the food quantity and overall bland taste become overwhelming after a few mouth fulls. Even the next day taking the food home and having it, still had the same problem. For the price, the quality of the food is below par.

My greatest issue was with the tipping policy, as the waiter had been excellent, I asked if the tip would go directly to him, in the Covid world, not carrying cash. He said a proportion would go to him, when a queried how much of £15 would go to him, he estimated 30p, as the rest of the tip is given amongst all the staff. Upon further discussion, it transpires that if I pay over the tip amount of £15 (via card), say £20, that extra £5 is not given to the staff, but the company keeps it, all in the name of Covid. I won't visit again.

title: Not just a stadium
text: The Panayhenaic Stadium isn’t just a stadium, but a tour through history. Be sure to climb all the way to the top, you won’t be disappointed with the views and the spectacular stadium.

title: A ‘must’ visit place when visiting Athens
text: You can’t avoid the acropolis on the skyline, and you won’t be disappointed when you enter. Full of history and spectacular views of Athens. I’d strongly recommend you go early to avoid the mid day sun, take lots of water and don’t hurry - you’ll be tired by the time you get to the top!

title: An average offering
text: An average offering from what is marketed as a premium eatery. Overall we were satisfied with our meals, but the portions and price did not meet our expectations on premium quality. One niggle is the number of fruit flies within the restaurant, there were loads and clearly no enhanced cleaning taking place.

title: A fun visit
text: A great visit with excellent service from Billie. Overall our visit was enjoyable, with staff very helpful and supportive throughout. The only disappointment was the lack of gluten free options on the menu (only 3: chips, peas and chicken wings) which meant one of our group had a very odd meal. Nevertheless Billie was support helpful.

title: The food was OK - not following the rules
text: The food was OK, drinks are very reasonably priced, but it was very disappointing to see multiple tables of 6 or more people - an the staff did nothing. It you're going to require people to sanitise their hands, and do track and trace, also enforce the maximum of 6 per table.

title: Poor quality food and expensive
text: What a waste of time, poor quality food, high price and the decour is horrible. The food was bland and lacked any seasoning, Cripsy lamb was soggy (indicting not fresh) and was cold in the middle. Staff were not attentive to any customer needs.

title: A long wait
text: The hype did not match our experience. Slow service (over 2 hours...), standard quality food and very camped considerations. The place was very dark and had to use a mobile phone to light the menu, and it was too noisy to hear anything. Overall, disappointing considering the price.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: From check-in, to the hotel bar, to dinner, to check-out, this hotel was fantastic. The staff were very helpful throughout the trip, the rooms were to a high spec and the dinner was one of the best meals I have ever had. I would highly recommend this hotel.
place: Ten Hill Place, BW Premier Collection

title: Great historic visit
text: This was a fantastic visit. Be mindful that it is a steep walk into the hotel, and it is very expensive (19.50) per person. Nevertheless, the history throughout the castle is amazing and it is very impressive that it is still a working military base.

title: Great coffee
text: Great coffee and a great vibe, the staff were slow in making the coffee but overall it was a great experience.

title: The rocky horror show
text: While this was an interesting museum to wonder around, throughout it lacked any 'story' and I was often confused as to what I was actually looking at, and why. Some of the items were also out of place, and the whole place dd have a rocky horror vibe.

title: The story from the perspective of the people
text: This museum tells you the story of the local people of Edinburgh It was great to read all the stories, and historical facts of the old town - with some great props. Overall, I walked away having a better grasp of the original Edinburgh.

title: Fantastic - Staff were super friendly
text: You'll have hours and hours of fun at the National Museum of Scotland. There was so much to do at the museum we ran out of time, and the staff were super friendly and helpful in pointing us in the right direction of the key exhibits. There is so much culture and variety here, it is a must see in the city.

title: Great helpful staff
text:
The staff were faultless at the Jolly Judge, they were very helpful when it came to whiskey, and were happy to offer tasters for different ones. On the beer front, they also had a large range Overall, great experience at the Jolly Judge.

Be mindful, this is a small cosy place so space will be limited.

title: Delightful
text: What a delightful experience. While the friendliness of the staff left a lot to be desired, the food was delightful and the ambiance was great for the setting. Having never had the beef wellington; it was top notch. They also had a wide range of wines, which covered all the wines you could possibly hope for.

title: An enjoyable visit
text: An enjoyable visit but we were let down with the quality of the food. Both dishes had to be sent back as one did not have the extra cheese and the other, a steak, was not cooked as requested. The dishes were not re-fined, the salad on the hot plate was not pleasant. However, staff were friendly and welcoming and overall we did enjoy our visit.

title: Poor quality food and incorrect bill
text: We were a group of 6 and spent several hours in Arthur Hooper's, more time waiting than actually eating. Staff were slow, inattentive and generally remained around the bar to chat. Dishes were incorrectly sent out, meats were not cooked to the correct level and the bill was incorrect. When challenged on the bill the staff refused to accept they got it wrong, once they performed a stock check they realised they'd added too many bottles onto the bill - no apology was given for potentially overcharging us by £100!

title: Mediocre
text: Nothing special about Olivelli - Bloomsbury, and it certainly did not meet the hype. Staff were inattentive, distracted by their phones and generally failed to deliver service with a smile. I ordered a well done steak which was delivered within 10 minutes of ordering - rare. This was pointed out to the staff we re cooked the steak I sent back (instead of making fresh) - no apology was given. Considering the price, you'd expect a better service.

title: Fun family trip
text: We had a family trip to Hoxton Grill for an evening meal - staff were friendly, portions were large and everything was reasonable priced. The atmosphere was great and everyone in the family enjoyed the trip. Be warned, it does get very loud in the evening!

title: Tell me more about Ipswich
text: As a newcomer to Ipswich I was hoping to learn more about the town, its origins, how it came about, the name and its history since formation. Sadly I left asking more questions, turning to Wikipedia to find out some of the information on the panels was in correct (or Wikipedia is...). Overall the museum is dated and requires some TLC, notably itemized information about what the exhibits are in each case would be useful.

title: It was actually rather... fun
text:
Visited here on a whim as an adult, it was great fun, worth the price for one hour and the trampolines met my expectations. Will certainly visit again. You need to be mindful of the little ones, but they largely stay well away of any adult.

Few issues however: 1) online price for lockers is different to what you actually pay, 2) staff enforced the rules but also broke them frequently by doing back-flips, running across multiple trampolines and doing front and back flips into the foam pit - lead by example...

title: Well presented
text: What a great way to spend two hours at Orford Castle.The castle is well preserved, with the audio guide doing an excellent job in explaining all the key areas. One niggle I had, it would have been great to know more about how the castle was used in WW2, not just a passing comment. Nevertheless, it was a great day out - but sure to visit Orford itself.

title: Vert attentive staff
text:
Great selection of food items with very attentive staff. The set menu was great value, especially considering it includes drinks. The crab ravioli was delicious but I'd like a little less sauce...

However, I was left a little anxious about tipping as it appeared tipping via card would be split out among all staff and not just the waiter which served us - which was a shame.

Overall, great experience.

title: Its going....down
text: This place used to be great, friendly, proactive and engaging staff, always willing to go the extra mile. Sadly that isn't the case any more, staff swearing at each other, shouting at each other and being louder than customers for periods of time isn't great for the experience. I also don't want to hear management discussing someones resignation on the floor. The major niggle I had was staff sitting at the bar chatting meant they failed to be attentive to tables - the only service I got was visiting the bar. Not once was I asked for a refill, its the small things. Come on guys. You got this. Be great again.

title: Nothing pretty about this beach
text: What a horrible experience visiting 'Pretty Bay', unless you're a cargo ship enthusiast, then this isn't for you. The sight of large container ships, large gangs, fighting, smell of sewage make this perhaps one of the worst beaches in the EU.

title: Lovely cafe - be prepared to wait
text: This was a lovely cafe with large portions at a really reasonable price. The only shame was the wait, it took almost an hour after me ordering to get the food. Views were nice.

title: A must visit
text: If you're visiting Malta then the Mdina Old City is the place to go. We were very lucky to have a guide who showed our group round; be sure to duck and dive into many of the smaller streets as you'll discover a lot of street art and hidden gems. It was amazing to see how the residents keep the streets clean and maintain the history of the hold city. It was the cleanest part of Malta.

title: Be sure to walk the waterfront
text: It was an hour well spent walking the waterfront, in addition to the amazing views and great food along the way it was impressive to see the large number of mast sail boats and linears..

title: Excellent guided tour
text: What a fantastic guided tour from the Lascaris War Rooms - it was a great to have someone walk you through the tunnel and explain the history of the tunnels; how they were created and how they were used. The only niggle was that I didn't get a true sense of what it was like in the tunnels - they were open and spacious but from all the photos this wasn't the case.

title: Stunning
text: It is a beautiful Cathedral with spectacular architecture and history makes this a must visit when in Valletta. The only shame was the entry price.

title: Worth a hike
text: This was a great way to spend a few hours hiking around the Clapham Junction Ruts and Caves. Be sure to take your time and explore all the caves, some of which are expertly hidden away. I'd recommend going either in the morning or late afternoon before the sun is high in the sky - otherwise it can become rather unpleasant.
place: Dingli Cart Ruts (Clapham Junction) and Caves

title: Good fun, lovely roasts except they charge for extra gravy
text: Overall a great experience, but was left very disappointed when we were charged extra for extra gravy - which was very disappointing.

title: Just average
text:
I did an online order which may have impacted the quality (great price). We received our fish and chips 20 minutes after ordering (which is great!), they were completely sodden (possibly the condensation) with the paper bag becoming part of the chips.

We had to place ours back in the oven to cook more and crisp up. It appeared that the chips had come straight out of the dryer and into the bag. Next time I'll visit Express Fish Bar instead of ordering online.

title: Fun day out
text: What a fun day out, we were delighted to have had the opportunity to visit Amberley Museum, something for everyone here. Especially for those who are interested in engineering. My only niggle was the cafe, which struggled with any type of queue - it needs to be more effective (possibly have two tills).

title: Shots for the staff...
text: I get it. The need to blow off steam is evident. But just because a customer buys all the staff a shot doesn't mean you make everyone else wait while you down the shots and 'recover' - this includes the duty manager. Overpriced (price increase again...), no wifi and rude staff make this one place to avoid. Just walk up in the hill for 3 minutes and ou get a Spoons.

title: Pushy service
text: The hype doesn't match reality. In all regards this is a Bone Daddies but more expensive. Food was of low quality and tasteless. The staff were very pushy and keen on getting us out the door as quickly as possible. Overall, disappointing.

title: Its functional....
text: What can I say, for £20, it wasn't bad - not great - but not bad either. It does what it says on the tin, gives you a bed for the night. Staff were friendly, room was OK, and toilet/shower worked - overall worked for what we needed it for.

title: Delightful
text:
What a delightful visit we had to Sugo Pasta Kitchen - staff were friendly, food was tasty and all at a reasonable price. The only disappoint, that we were not aware of, you do have to share tables when only 2/3 of you. But other than that, great fun.

Best pasta place in Manchester.

title: lacking.....everything
text:
What a let down. Visited here with a group of friends, we were left very disappointed.

Service: Walked up to an empty bar and waited 2 minutes to be served - staff looked at me and ignored me - they were too busy talking about a colleague learning to speak French.

Food: Over-priced and poor quality. No seasoning, the nachos are liquid cheese (yuk!) and the portion is is unacceptable for the price.

Drinks: They brand themselves as a micro-brewery - they didn't have a single one of their beers on tap - asked - they haven't had one for months!

Overall, let down, go elsewhere.

title: Fantastic
text:
What a great visit to Three Little Birds, the staff were friendly and the food was fantastic and really tasty. This is a true hidden gem of Brixton. Be warned, the food is spicy!

One niggle I had, we wanted to tip the barman and make this clear to the waiter that the tip was to go to him. When the waiter thought we were not looking, he kept the tip for himself (in his pocket).

title: Good fun and friendly staff
text: Visited here with a group of friends this weekend, it was a great evening out, with something very different for London. staff were friendly, plenty of toilets (even if a little dirty) and the whole inside is no smoking with a wide selection of food and drink.

title: Smelly, seedy and full of predatory men
text: Visited here with a group of female friends - throughout our visit they felt unsafe and were very cautious of the number of solo predatory men who were standing around the dance floor. These men were not dancing, nor were they in a group, they were standing watching females dance, occasional they would walk through them - I can only determine this was to either steal or attempt to take advantage. Staff failed to do anything about this.

title: Left us stranded twice!
text:
What a complete shambles Super Shuttle are. It didn't happen to us just once, but twice. This was a Business Executive booking, and I won't be booking again via them.

LAX to Hotel: Landed and called the number provided. Told them where I was waiting, told 15 minutes. 30 minutes later nothing, called the number again, told no ETA and that I should consider making my own way to the hotel. This was a pre-booked booking, no excuse at all for this. Cancelled the booking and got an Uber.

Hotel to LAX: Called up 40 minutes before my scheduled pickup to ensure that the van would turn up. I was told it was 15 minutes away. Waited 20 minutes it didn't turn up. Called up again, told that the booking at been reassigned to a driver, be with us in 20 minutes. Checked online tracking, he was in Santa Monica, no chance he'd get to us. Waited 20 minutes again, they reassigned to another driver, was promised he would be with us within 10 minutes. After 15 minutes he wasn't. In the end I cancelled the booking and got an Uber. Ended up getting to the airport 1 hour before flight departure.
place: Los Angeles Arrival Transfer: to Los Angeles Hotels

title: Limited menu but friendly staff
text: The menu is very limited, but what was on offer was delicious. Staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful in making suggestions on food items.

title: Suitable hotel room
text: Staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were large and maintained to a high standard. My only niggle was that breakfast was limited and not the greatest to start your day off strong. Further, the rooms did not have any milk for the coffee or tea bags.

title: Yummy but way too noisy
text: Visited here with friends, and the food was lovely. But I was disappointed that it was way too noisy due to everyone trying to speak over the loud music. It would have helped to turn it down. The food was tasty, but came out way too quick.

title: Functional Hotel
text: The hotel is functional, with basic facilities. Staff were polite, but cold and not very friendly. Breakfast (which is included) was very basic, with food being stale. The room was functional, but was cold at night - no spare duvet or blankets.

title: Nice view and enjoyable
text: Antica Osteria Dindi has great sea views, with staff being super friendly. My only niggle, for a sea food restaurant not to have most of the seafood options on the menu is disappointing. Oh, and be mindful, they charge for each bread basket if you eat it or not.

title: Enjoyable but need to work on presentation
text: The staff at the Forge were very friendly and helpful. We had a great time, my only negative would be the presentation of the food. I ordered a steak and skin on fries - they came separately and looked sparse. Also the steak was on its own, salad would have helped, or a sauce. That being said, enjoyable and would visit again.

title: 8 people causes a 50 minute delay
text: Nothing amazing at Cosy Club, left very disappointed. Waited 50 minutes for breakfast, the reason for the delay given, a table of 8 ordering at the same time. For the size of the establishment, they really should be able to handle a party of that size and not have it impact service. Food quality was average, price high for what was delivered.

title: Disgusting treatment of female customers
text: Visited here to finish off a business meeting. Was shocked to witness members of staff 1) discussing how to pick-up a customer, 2) approaching said customer several times (different staff taking it in turns to see 'how could get her number'), 3) making vulgar gestures behind her back. I felt terrible witnessing such acts, in the end the customer left not even having drunk half her drink. Terrible behaviour by all staff concerned (3 male, 1 appeared to be the shift supervisor).

title: Delightful
text: Absolutely splendid visit to Tredewells. Staff were friendly and welcoming with the quality of the food top notch. My only disappointment was when I pointed out to a member of staff a dangerous (exposed) power cable and they ignored me and told me not to worry. But overall I would recommend!

title: How early do you close
text: Staff were rude, unwelcoming and lacked knowledge of menu items. Staff failed to keep the place clean and tidy - I’d recommend giving the bathrooms a steam clean. To top it off, the place closes early on both Saturday and Sunday. Not a good go to place to drink.

title: Great fun
text: I was pleasantly surprised with my visit to Sit John Hawkshaw - with it being inside the station I thought it would be another station pub but I was wrong. Staff were friendly and welcoming - with a wide selection of craft beer and cider. A typically Weatherspoons - my only niggle was it was super cramped inside and they didn’t have any toilets.

title: Peaceful
text: St. James's Park is the ideal location to sit and relax in the heart of hectic London. It is amazing that when you stand in the middle of the park the London traffic noises all disappear. The ponds are lovely during the summer months with the wide verity of birds.

title: Great vibe
text: Visited several times recently for business meetings. The Coral Room has a great vibe with the staff being very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

title: Disappointing
text: Visited here due to proximity to the train station, ended up being very disappointed. The service was slow, and had to wave down the staff several times to a) make the order, b) clear the table, c) pay the bill. Further, when visiting the toilet you were able to hear the kitchen staff who were swearing and shouting at each other. The food quality was poor for the price, I'm not convinced that providing half a lettuce is wise. Overall, ended up leaving disappointed.

title: Delightful
text: What an absolute delight! A great evening at Tredwells. Staff were friendly, food was delicious and the overall atmosphere was great. Staff were very knowledgeable about the wine, and the food ingredients. The food was lovely. Highly recommend.

title: Bland bland bland
text: I was very disappointed with my recent experience at Tonkotsu Stratford. The staff were lack luster, not attentive and the whole place felt rather grim (and cold). I ordered the Venison Special, the meat was dry, little broth in the dish and a lack of seasoning. I mentioned this to the member of staff who simply stated this is how it comes. Overall, disappointing.

title: Delightful
text: Visited here as I was in the area. Staff were friendly and welcoming. The coffee was lovely, and the food was delicious. Would recommend.

title: Historic Colchester
text: A great couple of hours spent exploring Colchester Castle. It was worth every penny spent. The staff were friendly, welcoming and happy to answer the questions I had. There was so much to do, and lots of local and national history on display. Great for families.

title: Unique and iconic
text: What a hidden gem, visited here based on the suggestion of a work colleague. I was surprised at how lovely the interior was. It is great to see a historic, listed building being used in such a respectful way - well done Wheatherspoons. However, it was a little creepy to have all the faces looking at you (visit and you'll see what I mean).

title: Fun landmark
text: Visited here as I was passing, it was a lot of fun to see some historic London! Staff were very friendly and supportive in explaining how the bridge worked, and best route to take. The views from the 'Span' were breathtaking. My only niggle, I walked away still not understanding why the bridge was built, its history since building and why/how it was electrified.

title: A great hotel but staff attitude should be improved
text: Visited this hotel for work, experienced both the hotel rooms and the conference rooms. Overall the hotel rooms were to a high standard, staff were very focused on ensuring all rooms were clean quickly and promptly. All rooms were very spacious and you heard very little outside noise. The conference rooms were attended to very well, cleaned after each session and had all the AV equipment needed. However, the staff can be, at times, very rude, and this should be addressed.

title: not geared for business
text:
I was very disappointed to stay at Premier Inn Edinburgh Airport as a business visitor. The sleep quality was OK; however the rooms were very cold and staff were not able to warm the rooms up due to outside temperature.

Then, I needed some documents printing, staff refused stating they don't offer this service (bizzare). Then on to the food, I requested a steak well done, it came medium and had to be sent back to be 're-fired' instead they just re-cooked the same steak (with the garlic butter on it!) - I demanded a new steak and was told no. Finally, to get to my meetings I used the hotel taxi, which charged 2x what the local firm (not booked via the hotel).

Overall, poor stay from rooms to food to hotel taxi's - I'll consider elsewhere next time.

title: Lovely food
text: We visited here on a whim, the food was delightful and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. We would visit again when passing through.

title: Great visit
text: What a great day. The grounds and castle is spectacular. Staff were all very helpful, knowledgeable about the castle, and keen to share everything they know. Make sure you walk around the mount, you get a great perceptive!

title: just ok
text: Visited here as a group, it was disappointing to see that the staff were not very attentive to our table. We had to ask several times to make drinks orders, make the food order or pay the bill. It was a shame to see our food arrive before our drinks, considering it wasn't very busy. Food was lovely when it came.

title: Great food
text: A historic pub with a great selection of foods and beers. They also have great views from the outside deck and upstairs. Staff were friendly, menu was reasonable priced and very atmospheric.

title: Delicious
text: We needed somewhere to go when we visited Macclesfield , we were not disappointed with Aristo. The food was delightful, staff were friendly and to top it all, they provided us with a complementary drink at the end.

title: Delicious but spicy
text: Be prepared, the food is very spicy, if you struggle with hot food, this isn't the place for you. It would help if the menu indicates which food items are spicy. However, that being said, the food is tasty and staff are very friendly. You can't reserve a table so you may want to arrive early. Reasonably priced.

title: Great toasties
text: We were not disappointed with our visit. The tune tootsie was awesome. Great portion size for the price. The staff were friendly, service was quick and overall we had a great time.

title: A classic pub
text: The Lass O' Gowrie is a classic in Manchester. Great selection of ciders, beers and bottles. Staff were super friendly and quick with the service. Great interior and atmosphere.

title: Suitable stay - Could be better
text: This could be a gem, the hotel is dated and does need a face lift in the room. The front of house (bar, restaurant, reception) have all been refurbished, but the rooms have not. The staff were friendly, and for the price, was a bargin.

title: Fantastic trip
text: It is well worth a visit. At present, the Bodleian has an exhibition of J.R.R Tolkien, showcasing his works. The library is open, inviting and friendly. They have a wide selection of books on offer, however you do need to be a member before you can rent any books.

title: Yummy Mexican food
text: the food from Wahaca was a delight, very tasty and served very quickly. Staff were friendly and helpful with the food order. My only niggle, I wish they would sort the tables out so they are level and not moving around the place.

title: Busy and cramped
text: Visited the restaurant with friends, it was very busy and they have crammed in more tables than is wise, making it an uncomfortable meal. The food was nice and staff were friendly. If you are goign to a catch-up, this may not be the place, everyone can overhear your conversations.

title: Delightful
text: You never know what you are going to get with a B&B, but with Wheelers Green Bed and Breakfast we were delighted with our stay. Excellent quality accommodation with fantastic friendly hosts. I would highly recommend staying.

title: Poor service, poor choice and and chef with a pint
text:
It amazes me that staff thinks it is accept to be drinking while on duty. Visited here on a quite day and witnessed the chef walk in to the kitchen with a pint of beer, may explain why my sweet potato fries took 40 minutes to come out (only 3 other people in).

The place lacks any atmosphere at all.

title: Staff require training and incorrect menu
text:
Staff were rude and unhelpful. The staff refused to make a cocktail that was on the menu by stating it wasn't something they'd be told to make so will not do it. They also stated they have never looked at the customer menu as they do not see the need.

Staff should look at the customer menu! How else do you know what to serve. Rude staff, poor cocktails and expensive for the price.

title: Friendly staff and good breakfast
text: Used this as a meeting location with family. The staff were friendly and welcoming. They took our orders quickly and promptly. The food was tasty and at a reasonable price. Overall, a very good visit.

title: Good family visit
text: We had a really good time at the Harvester at Ashton Moss. Staff were very friendly and welcoming. The service was quick and prompt considering how busy they were. The food was enjoyable and portions sizes were large. Overall a really enjoyable visit.

title: Very enjoyable evening at GP
text: Visited here as part of a large group. The private room was ideal for our group. Staff were attentive and able to answer questions related to the menu. GP is in an ideal location with delicious food and wide bar selection.

title: Even the staff think its rankie
text: Visited here when visiting Cambridge, its unlike any other Frankie & Benny's I've visited previously. The staff were rude, the food quality was poor and wait times were terrible. All food portions were small, the meat had grissle/fat and was not cooked to the required level. When reviewing my bill, it seems the staff have changed the company name to Rankie & Benny's.

title: Good meeting place
text: Visited the The Matchstick Man as a location for a meeting. Staff were friendly, there was a large food selection and nice atmosphere. Free parking is available for customers which is great. They also have an outside area which can get noisy due to the trams.

title: It will do for a night, but best prices are not guaranteed
text: It's a suitable hotel for a single night's stay. Basic room, with an OK nights quality of sleep. I was disappointed to see that the sign outside states "best prices guaranteed online at ibis...", which I booked via. When I arrived the room price was £10 cheaper, asked for the member of staff to match the price (as I booked via the site) and she rudely refused.

title: Great fun but food portion sizes are small
text: Visited here on a whim, hoping to get a free lane and we were very lucky that there was a cancellation. Staff were friendly, and the bowling was great fun. However, I had two concerns 1) the portion size for a large fries was disappointingly small 2) while sitting in the bar we saw a mouse run across the floor, mentioned to staff who just laughed about it.

title: Delightful
text: I travel all the way from London to visit The Indian Plaza, the food was delightful, authentic indian food made to order. The only niggle was that staff kept on pestering to make an order. It would be great if they leave you to it, it wasn't busy! But overall, cheap and awesome food.

title: Terrible
text:
What a visit, I will never visit again. Visited here to 'scope out the place' for a future event, we will be staying well clear. The staff were very rude, provided slow service, were very insulting to customers and failed to maintain basic hygiene standards. For example, a customer approached the bar to make an order, he spoke very well, after he left, staff made fun of his language and speech. On the hygiene front, the staff dropped a measurer on the floor, accidentally stood on it, picked it up and used it for a drink (without cleaning it).

Tables were sticky and wonky making it a pain to keep hold of a drink.
Overall, a dreadful pub.

title: Delightful
text:
We were able to get a booking at the last minute in the bar, while not the full a la carte menu, you still get a wide selection of food choices at a very reasonable price. The food was wonderful, tasty, wholesome and filling. We left very satisfied. The only niggle was that it appeared the staff were neglecting the bar (only one person) and we did have to wait some time before we ever saw the waiter.

However, other than that, great visit and will be going back.

title: Helpful staff and good food
text: Went here as we simply needed something to eat, it was a delight. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Very helpful in explaining the menu, and very attentive at the bar. When our food order was incorrect they sorted it out very quickly and very apologetic. Overall, enjoyable food and good service

title: Just bland and poor service
text: The food was bland and tasteless, it lacked seasoning - which is important when all you have are veterinarian dishes. The presentation can also be improved. The service was terrible, staff were not attentive, not help in providing allergy advice (big concern) and unaware of menu items. Overall, disappointing.

title: Terrible waitress experience, loud and pool closed
text:
As others have noted, the pool was closed when we visited for a private event. It would be helpful to know about this in advance.

Service is very important, this venue had none for us. Therefore the low rating. Upon arrival we asked an employee should we order at the bar and sit down and wait. He informed us to sit down as it was table service and someone would be with us. After waiting 20 minutes next to the serve station we had to flag over the waitress (Niccole) to order our drinks and food. She was unhelpful, despondent and very short. She was also using her phone multiple times and very difficult to flag down. With the high price paid, it is important to have a good experience. It sadly tarnished ours.

The views of LA are enjoyable, the drinks and food are on the pricey side. I would recommend a visit, just have one and order at the bar to avoid the wait for service.

title: Enoyable
text: Staff were friendly and the location was spectacular. Parwa Restaurant offered a large range of local foods, cooked and made fresh while you wait. We were a group of 10, and they were able to seat us and serve us quickly. We were delighted with the concept and ideology of the Parwa Restaurant, the community cooking for the benefit of the community.

title: Not enjoyable, rushed and dog excrement
text:
We had high hopes for visiting the Planetarium Cusco, however we were left bitterly disappointed. The Planetarium is located down an unlit dark road, its very unsafe to walk at a night, when we arrived at the Planetarium, there were multiple dogs walking around the grounds with dog excrement (including smell) everywhere! So watch where you are walking. The location has no heating and is very cold at night.

While the staff were friendly, the presentation was rushed due to other groups waiting and when outside using the telescopes we were allow one view each before being sent away. Instead of chasing the money, the Planetarium should focus on cleaning up (removing the dogs) and not rushing customers.

title: Functional and great for an overnight stay
text: Be warned, this hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the train station (up hill). The hotel was clean, presentable and staff were friendly and welcoming. Our room had two double beds, with ample space to store luggage with an amazing view of the mountains around Aguas Calientes. The breakfast in the mornng offered a wide selection of items, including both hot and cold.

title: Great experience with the community
text: Visited the Potato Park, which is a community market run by the local, it was a fanatic experience. The locals were welcoming, happy to share their experiences and customers. It is great to see the local community coming together to try and make a living from tourism. We are a talk by the 'Chief', who shared the history of the park, then had the ability to purchase handmade items and taste some potato harvested that day! Brilliant trip.

title: Amazing experience but...
text:
Visited here as part of a group, it was an amazing experience, a once in a lifetime trip. I strongly recommend you get to Machu Picchu as early as possible, it gets very VERY busy as the morning goes on and you'll end up waiting (in queues to move around) and have loads of tourist in your photos. Some other tios:

1. The Inca Bridge was excellent, it hardly has any tourists (all scared of heights I assume). Don't believe those who says its a small path you have plenty of space to move comfortably.

2. Make sure you leave early to get the bus, the queue gets crazy to get down the mountain! Be prepared to wait at least an hour.

3. BE CAREFUL: The only restaurant at Machu Picchu will only let you pay in US Dollars, they also add a 10% tip to every order (they don't mention it to you). The service is poor and the food is of low quality. Therefore, take your own food.

Overall a great experience, just very busy.

title: Lares Trek IS worth the effort
text:
This was one of the hardest, and at the same time most rewarding Trek's I have ever done. The Lares Trek is the hidden gem of routes to Machu Picchu, its very quiet (many tourists choose to do the Inca Trail), the views are amazing and the ability to push yourself to 4,800 meters - which is difficult. The campsites were of high quality with flush toilets and cold showers.

Be prepared for a hard trek, the path is very rocky and muddy, there is no walkway! Make sure you have a good pair of hiking boots and make sure you rent hiking poles. They really do come in handy!

On the Lares Trek you will encounter many impoverished children and families, try to bring some toys etc to hand out out, they really will appreciate it.

TIP: Take small change, you'll need to pay for toilets along the way. They will not have change to hand out!

We did our tour with G Adventures who were fantastic!

title: Great Ruins
text: This was a superb adventure through the Archaeological Park Ollantaytambo ruins. The views and the history keeps you engaged throughout the entire tour. I recommend taking at least half a morning to visit the site, there is so much to do anything less makes it very difficult and you'll be kicking yourself for not being able to do it.

title: Pisac Ruins were great
text: We visited the Pisac Ruins on a recent trip to Peru. Visiting the Pisac Ruins is a must, its only a short drive from Cusco, but it is recommended to go with a tour guide to get all the history of the site. The site is full of history and amazing views.

title: Great hotel and location
text: Hotel Taypikala Cusco is a hidden gem, it is in a great location and the hotel itself is finished to a high standard. Staff are welcoming and friendly, always willing to help. The rooms are well furnished and clean. The food (breakfast and dinner) was delightful, you are provide with a large selection to choose from which is cooked fresh. Overall, great hotel.

title: Hidden gem in Lima
text: We had a great stay at Antigua Miraflores Hotel in Lima. A perfect location for walking around Miraflores with easy access to archaeological sites, shops, restaurants and beach. Staff are friendly and welcoming with rooms furnished to a high standard. Overall, great hotel for solo travelers, couples, friends and families.

title: Impressive
text: While it was impressive to watch the changing of the guard, it was a little underwhelming. It is difficult to hear the band play due to the local churches all ringing their bells at the same time.

title: Could be a great hotel
text:
This could be a great hotel, but a series of unfortunate events lead me to rate this hotel down.

We booked an airport pickup via the hotel, however upon arrival our room was not ready and were required to wait 45 minutes, with no apology given nor any explanation about wifi or breakfast (when, where) etc.

Further, the hotel is right next door to a building site which is very noisy between 0730 and 1700 - it was not possible to change rooms and therefore it was difficult to rest (I was ill). This should have been discovered prior to booking.

The bar/restaurant only accepted cash and it is not possible to place the cost on to your room. We were caught out by this and had to go cash machine to pay - although frustratingly the waiter went downstairs to hotel reception to change the money.

The staff were friendly, rooms were of good quality and the hotel is ideally located.

title: Marvelous
text:
What can I say, from start to finish Astrid & Gaston was marvelous, the staff were friendly and knowledgeable, the food was delightful and the atmosphere is spine tingling good. It was great to see that all staff were allergy aware and very conscious about my allergies.

My only niggle, less is sometimes more, the portion sizes are very large, this is not a fine dining menu.

title: Tourist trap
text: This meets the definition of a tourist trap. The Train Cemetry is not maintained or looked after. Tourists are able to climb over every train, and generally damage the site. You can visit this site without any tour guide. Still, its impressive to see but it is difficult to get any great shots due to hundreds of tourists being there at all times.

title: Safety first
text: Overall Todo Turismo is safe and very easy to use. The coaches are brand new, but lack USB changing points which is a let down for a tourist bus. When you board you are given a hot meal and hot drink, for breakfast you get a sandwich and drink. The wifi is very intermittent and only worked on way. Further, the bus played the exact same film both ways, they could at least change it up a bit.

title: Great day but you need to be careful
text:
I am an experienced cyclist, and cycling the Death Road is no joke. It was one of the greatest rides I have ever done, but also on of the most challenging. You can serious hurt yourself if you not pay attention. Slow and steady wins the race (ride in this case).

Select a reputable company and you won't be disappointed. It was a great day with spectacular views , although its sobering to see so many memorials on the descent due to all the deaths.

title: Awesome! Except the Tourist Sell
text:
Lets admit this straight away, this is a tourist trap where you will be pressured to buy items from the locals. However, it was an amazing experience, the islands truly are floating and the locals do live on the islands. We were lucky to be able to take a boat tour by the locals (you have ti pay for this), the boat is a full wicker boat and it was a great experience.

This is a unique experience that you do not want to miss.

title: Truly spectacular
text:
Tambopata Ecolodge is one of the best experiences of our entire trip to Peru. It takes about 3 hours to arrive at Tambopata Ecolodge via the river, but the views along the way are amazing, you may even get to spot some wildlife.

When you arrive at the lodges, they are all eco friendly with running hot water and flush toilets. There is electricity which runs during the night to enable to power devices. The lodge makes all food fresh and is sourced locally from a farmer. We had Hugo and Edwin as our guides, they were a true credit to the Ecolodge, they were knowledgeable, friendly and outgoing.

Delightful stay.

title: OK for a night
text:
This hostel is suitable for the night, however any long term stay I would recommend staying elsewhere. The rooms are furnished to a low quality, with the beds being uncomfortable and toilet/shower were dirty. The bedroom also had the strong odor of cigarette smoke which wasn't enjoyable to sleep in.

What this hostel has going for it is the fact it is located to the bus terminal.

title: Uncomfortable stay
text:
We were advised when booking (Booking.com) that this hostel spoke English, however when we arrived the receptionist did not speak any English. Due to the language barrier the receptionist did try to overcharge us, thankfully I had a copy of our Booking.com reservation. While waiting for our room the receptionist passed us the telephone, it was a tour company attempting to sell us tours for our visit. This felt very pushy and made us feel very uncomfortable and pressured.

The rooms are OK and were clean, with the shower and toilet also both being clean. We heard staff throughout the night, they created a lot of noise.

title: Great location and good value
text: The hostel is located just off the beaten track, which is great as it is quiet. The hostel is functional, with staff being friendly and welcoming. It was a shame that they were not able to accept card payments.

title: Where is the seasoning?
text: I was very disappointed with my visit, while the staff were friendly the quality of the food was well below what I would have expected. The burger was dry and lacked any seasoning making it a very tasteless burger (I had the honest burger). The onion rings were mainly just batter and not actual onion, they were very disappointed with the proportion of batter to onion. Overall, friendly staff but poor quality food.
